summary: In this context, 1,1,2-trichloroethene (TCE) is identified as a volatile organic chemical (VOC) that is commonly found in drinking water supplies and is frequently detected in blood samples of nonoccupationally exposed individuals. The discussion highlights TCE's prevalence as an organic chemical contaminant, particularly in groundwater near hazardous waste sites, indicating its significance as a representative example of organic chemicals in environmental health studies.
